page.title: 05LEISURE FACILITIES cont.
page.content: A survey on leisure time conducted amongst third year pupils of Chasetown High School showed that various sports e.g.football,cycling and horse riding, were the most popular. Nearly as many pupils,however,spent most of their leisure time watching T.V or visiting friends and relitives.Most pupils had to be back home between 9.30 and 10.00p.m.,although a few were able to stay out late.All pupils received pocket money with the majority having one pound per week or less.A fortunate few received more than five pounds per week.Nearly all pocket money was spent on leisure related activites.An example of these activities are swimming,ball sports,records and magazines.Others simply saved their money in a bank for special occasions.As sports facilites may cost quite a lot,people often save to hire them.
